Summary Heading: will make this the hotel for disneyland
Summary: I was unsure about this hotel from all the reviews, We stayed here for 10 nights in the suite which includes 3 beds and two rooms. It is not a five star hotel but it is a great hotel. It is just 5 minutes to walk to downtown disney and 10 minutes to the front gates of the parks. It is a very quite place to stay which is nice after all the hustle from disneyland. The staff is great i have never stayed anywhere with that friendly of a staff. Also i didnt realize that my son left out van door open all night and nothing was stolen even with all the dvd players in the vehicle. I will stay here again and again. we watched the fireworks from our hotel room everynight that we were not in the parks. The only complaint that i have is the pillows are flat, but with everything else you
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: My new favorite place to stay in Anaheim
Summary: I stayed here 2 nights with my family in their suite which is only 5 dollars more than their 2 bedroom. And loved it. The separate room was great for the baby. You couldn't hear any noise from the other rooms, there was a refrigerator and microwave in the room without having to pay extra and it was just a 15 minute walk to disneyland. I have stayed in a lot of hotels and think this is the best room for your money.
Manager Response: none

Summary: The best reason to stay here is it's close proximity to Disneyland. It's all one-story with a pool and the staff are friendly.  It is well lit, but not secure and they do have a small continental breakfast available. There was a microwave and small cube fridge, but the alarm clock was unplugged. Nice to be able to regulate the room temp.  The bathroom was small, not a big deal for one person, but there were ants around the sink, toilet and mirror.  The toilet paper and tissue were the worst! The bed was made with dirty sheets that had tears in them and the pillows offered no support.  As another reviewer mentioned, the beds are uncomfortable.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My family & I took a trip to Disneyland to celebrate a few birthdays. Now, we chose this hotel because it's literally two blocks from Disneyland. But the rooms itself were not great. The rooms reeked of smoke (even the non-smoking ones). The toilet was clogged. The beds were extremely uncomfortable; I ended up sleeping on the floor. Our power went out for about an hour. We had one channel of cable, whereas one of our other rooms (the exact same type of room) had about 100 channels. It was very odd. The experience at the hotel sucked. The staff was extemely friendly, which made the experience that less sucky but if you're someone with very little patience, this hotel isn't for you. But if you want somewhere close to Disneyland, this is the area you want to be in.
Manager Response: none

Summary: I've traveled all over the US and this is by far the worst place I've ever stayed...  Upon check in we were greeted by an Indian who spoke little English.  The lobby is the size of a Kohl's dressing room.  There is a small walk-up window on the side of the lobby.  This leads me to believe the lobby is locked at night and the managers live in the room attached to the lobby.  What a pleasure that must be.    The room stunk.  The TV's were from the 1980's.  The microwave was from Big Lots. Im guessing the phones at one point appeared to be white but could not tell through the yellowing.  The AC/Heater smelled like burnt hair.  The bathroom light flickered which was like being in a dance club with a strobe light.  Perhaps this was intended due to hide the pincher bugs crawling
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Great, cheap option with wonderful hosts.
Summary: Nick, one of the proprietors, is a lovely man who goes out of his way to make you feel welcome.   Anything I asked of him was not a problem at all, from asking for some extra fruit, to getting another access key to the free wifi.   Let's face it you're not at Disneyland to sit in your hotel room, so why not save some money on it!?  Only an extra 200m walk to the actual Disneyland hotels... This is the place to be!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Spend extra $10 on a better hotel!
Summary: this hotel was disgusting! its like a very cheap motel. Right when you enter the room there's a strong odor! I can't tell what it is smells like dirty carpet, mold i don't know. I've never had any reviews with the hotel i stayed before but this is worst! Oh and don't be fooled with the continental breakfast, it's only coffee (which you'll wish you get it from a gasoline station instead), toast, donut, muffin thats it! One more thing beds are not comfy at all i dont have any allergies but when i'm inside the room i kept sneezing and ened up with a cold but when i'm outside im ok. I tell you spend extra $10 to anoter hotel. Worst 2nights!!!
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I definately do not recommend it..
Summary: Upon check-in, there was an indian man who was difficult to understand & took over 10mins to stop talking to a friend and assist us. The 1st room we checked into smelled of mold (they had left the door open in attempt to air it out) and the fridge did not close. We asked to change rooms and this time the AC was mussing knobs, found a few bugs, and the fridge was tiny. I not only feel scammed by their pictures (the pool is tiny and dirty aswell) but I will not be going again.
Manager Response: none

Summary: My husband and I stayed in this hotel from Jan 13-17, 2011 during the NAMM convention in Anaheim.  The room REEKED of mold, you could see visible mold growing on the ceilings in the bathroom and the bedroom.  Then on the first night, I discovered a bedbug in my bed!!!  HORROR!  I took a picture of it with my iPhone (not the greatest quality image) and killed the bug.  Fortunately, I did not see any others during our stay.  We kept our suitcases off the floor on the stands that were provided and sanitized EVERTHING when we got home.  I reported the mold and the bedbug to the property management and was told "Sorry".  I requested a discount for the inconvenience and horrible mold small AND for the fact that I would now have to unpack in the garage at home and fumigate everything
Manager Response: none

Summary: My wife and I spent one night with our 10 month-old son in the Anaheim Discovery Inn and Suites.   Given the Tripadvisor reviews, I was very pleased with the condition of our room and had a nice one-night stay.   My wife and I would prefer to stay at somewhat inexpensive hotels, so long as they are reasonably clean. We stayed in one of the suite rooms ($63 - only $5 more than the regular room price), so that we would have a separate room to set up the pack-n-play for our 10 -month old son. The furnishings were somewhat worn, but the carpet appeared to be brand new, the mattress seemed new and comfortable, and the bathroom was very clean. The walls were somewhat dinged up and could certainly use painting, but given the cleanliness of the carpet and bathroom - we could not have
Manager Response: none

Summary: I called the Econo Lodge directly to make a reservation. Later, I needed to cancel and I talked to the same man with an Indian accent. He was hard to understand and to add to the frustration, he seemed to not have a grasp of his job though he told me he was the manager. Also, when I called to cancel he told me to call a 1-800 number to "finalize" cancellation and when I did the customer service agent said my confirmation number given to me was not only not valid but 4 digits short. So, I called the manager back of the hotel and he said to call him directly next time to cancel.... What???? Anyway, glad I canceled before I even had to stay there.

Summary: Disgusting! And I am no lightweight. I have stayed in better places in rural latin america than this. dirty headboards, filthy chair by desk, dirty floor, transient hot water. DO NOT STAY HERE! This Econolodge is awful. A friend said the other nearest one (in Orange I think) is better.

Summary: Pro's: The people there were  nice Con's:  When we turned on the air it smelled like urine-it was so horrible.  They charged our credit card for the whole trip the day we got there.  We stayed three nights.  It was the worst hotel I have stayed in. We had the two room suite which really isn't a suite, very small and the room in back had the worst bed, it felt like two box springs.  The bed in the front room was okay.  We could hear someone snoring in the next room.  I would not stay there again.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Close to the Park for Under $50 - No Frills but Good Value
Summary: We paid $49 per night for our room  – we expected a basic room and that’s exactly what we got. This was an excellent value considering its prime location—it sits right across from Disneyland’s parking lot and is a short walk to the park by cutting through the Grand Californian’s lobby.   The staff was very friendly and accommodating. They even called 15 minutes after check in to see if our room was okay! They have muffins, coffee and juice in the lobby each morning, quite nice considering the price of the room.   The rooms could use some paint and the furniture was a little beat up, but for $49 a night this was well within reason. The beds were fine and we slept well. Rooms have a mini-fridge, microwave, iron and blow dryer. One thing we did find unacceptable was the complete
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: I expected more for the price.
Summary: Pros: The office staff was nice and friendly.  The bed in the main part of the tiny two-room suite was relatively comfortable.  Cons: Rooms need major renovations.  It might be better to just gut the place or tear it down.  I was shocked that this is a Choice Hotels property.  It makes me wonder about deciding to stay at another Choice Hotels property in the future. The location is perfect for the Anaheim Convention center and proximity to Denny's and a couple of other restaurants.  For next year's convention, I've got to find a better, cleaner place. Way, way overpriced.   Would not stay here again.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,                        We sincerely apologize for incovinience during stay in our hotel.We are still in process of renovating hotel along with rooms and trying to make it done as soon as possible.give us a chance to serve you better next time.

Summary: My family and I went to Anaheim for a business and pleasure trip.  Trying to save money on this trip, we checked-in in Econolodge (At the Park) right across from Disneyland Park.  It was very convenient parking our van right in front of our room having a family who likes to overpack on every trip, and me the dad is always the one loading and unloading their things.  Best off all, we received the best treatment from management, easy to talk to and with a smile.  Originally we booked a room just for my wife and I for this trip, and at the last minutes, the kids wanted to come and I didn't have time to change my reservation. Management was kind enough to give me a larger room/suite so that I can do work on a spacious living room while the kids watch TV and surf the internet with
Manager Response: Dear Guest,                         We are very much thankful for  your compliments regarding our hotel.We are happy to hear that your stay was upto your expectation and you liked the staff working here.We are still in a process in making your stay more comfortable by making some amendments in the hotel. Summary: i love to travel and i stay at a lot of different hotels.  I usually try to keep to the cheaper hotels because for me its just a place to sleep... i dont care if the walls are scuffed up or there is a crack in the floor etc. This hotel was so bad i am contemplating ever even staying in a chioce hotel ever again...  The room looked pretty bad when we walked in about an inch of the bottom of the door was broken the sofa bed was all torn and the walls were horribly dirty. gross.  I do have to say that the bed was one of the best beds i have slept on but that was this hotels only saving grace.   we went in to rest up before going back to disneyland and when we got ready to leave all of our food was covered in ants...NOT okay. I got the manager and he came in and (helped) ME clean up
Manager Response: Dear guest,                        I sincerely apologize for inconvinence during the stay in our hotel.I am really sorry for food spoiled by ants in the room and also for smell of the spray but that only to make sure that it doesn`t get spread more in whole area.I am very much thankful for appreciating our beds as we just changed the mattress of all our rooms and also we are about to replace tv`s.In addition to that we have started refinishing of our rooms which includes bathroom too.Our maintainance department have treated all the rooms for the ants and roaches just to make sure that it doesn`t occur again in future. Summary Heading: You get what you pay for, and sometimes even less
Summary: This is not really within "walking distance" unless you like a 25 minute walk to the park along a very busy road and over a freeway that is an unsafe walking environment in the best of circumstances.  The neighborhood has seen better days - about 30 years ago - and the scariest part of our trip was not the Matterhorn, or Space Mountain, but walking (actually running) back to the motel at midnight.  The shuttle was not offered when we stayed there.  The toilet flooded the first time we used it, which necessitated being moved to a different room, in which management was helpful, the new room bigger for the same price.  And if you are tall, watch you head walking into the motel lobby, or better yet, wear a helmet - anyone 6'3" or over will be "scalped" by the low door frame - ouch!
Manager Response: none

Summary: For being part of the Choice hotel chain, the hotel needs an upgrade. The king size bed was uncomfortable, did not get a good nights sleep. The walls were marred, and someone must have been really mad, as there was almost a hole in the wall(room 107). Carpets are stained, and no microwave or fridge in room, even though was stated on reservation. I just stayed at a different Econo Lodge earlier in the week , much nicer. There is room for improvement, especially since there are so many choices in Anaheim.
Manager Response: none

Summary Heading: Good Location to get to the park!!!!
Summary: we stay on march 24 to the 25 and found this econolodge on the road, they had great rates for the room including wireless internet and a basic continential breakfast then it was like ten minutes from the entrance of disneyland going throught the disneyland hotel and onto downtown disney, this hotel is a bargain if your staying to go to disneyland!

Summary Heading: Went to have a good time for my birthday....turned out to be a nightmare!
Summary: I stayed at the Ecno Lodge at the Park on Katella drive for my birthday to attend Disneyland. When we first checked in everything seemed to be okay…typical budget motel. We were assigned and given two keys to room 110. So we left for Disneyland. We came back a few hours later to eat and freshen up. We were about to walk into our room when we were quickly stopped by housekeeping. My boyfriend not knowing what was going on proceeded to open the door. We then saw someone else’s things in OUR room. My boyfriend and I were extremely upset and proceeded to the front desk. The guy at the front desk told us there “usual” customer who stays on a monthly basis, came to check in and he only likes to stay in room 110(the room we were originally assigned to). So without our knowledge they

Summary Heading: OK but there are better options
Summary: I just returned from a trip that included two nights at the EconoLodge.  The room was booked by a friend I was traveling with.  I would have chosen another location, as you can get the Anaheim Plaza for around the same rate and it's a much shorter walk, bigger rooms, nicer pool, great gift shop, etc.  In any case, I will say the staff at the front desk were VERY nice in a very genuine, helpful way.  There is a Food 4 Less just down the street to pick up some breakfast items or other supplies or Coco's a couple of doors down.  Skip the hotel's free continental bfast - it was worthless.  I think the only "juice" they had was tang.  Not much else.  The walk is doable.  About 15-20 minutes to the front gate.  A bit of a long stretch for our little ones at the end of the day.  Cut

Summary: This stay refers to the Econo Lodge at the Park on Katella Ave.  I stayed here over Presidents weekend using my Choice Hotels points and found it to be an excellent value.  The place was a little old, but it was a direct walk to disneyland.  If you are planning on being in the park all day and just need a clean, convinient, and inexpensive place to lay your head, this place is perfect!  For 6k choice hotels points per night (the equivilant to about $70 room), I was able to book a 2-bedroom room, which gave us more privacy than having two queen beds side by side (there were two couples sharing the room).  The beds were not very comfortable, but each day we were exauhsted so it didn't matter much!  On a side note, the walls are very thin.  The doors open up to the parking lot so

Summary: My husband and I spent one night in this hotel and the following day went to the Marriott in Santa Ana for the remainder of our five day trip.  This Econo Lodge was in a run-down part of town.   There were two beds; one bed had a big tear in the bedspread.  The other bed slanted down on one side, and when we turned down the bedspread, there was a tear on the inside, and the blanket was old, thin, and worn.   There was a low watt light bulb in the overhead light, which gave it a very dingy, shabby look.  There was a table with two chairs, and the chairs were dirty and stained.  We slept on top of the bed with our clothes on and left the next morning.  We couldn't wait to leave.  The hotel had a very depressing feel to it. I took a cup full of these bugs down to the front desk where I demanded a refund and we left.  GROSS.  Don't do it.   This hotel needs lots of work.

Summary Heading: DISGUSTING!  Mold Everywhere! Awful Bed! Not Cheap!
Summary: I tried to be frugal and book a plain, basic hotel room to sleep in on a quick weekend trip to Disneyland.  My $79 room was COMPLETELY MOLDY!  I assume the carpets had been cleaned/wet, then the room was sealed up for several days because the smell was everywhere.  The bathroom wood and walls were completely spotted and disintegrated from this.  The beds were ancient and would have been more comfortable if I slept on the box spring itself.  NEVER AGAIN!  I spent the next night at the wonderful and hospitable Fairfield Inn by Marriott on S. Harbor for $110.  TOTALLY worth the extra $30.  They gave me an 8th floor roon with a view of the pool and Disneyland.  Their bed was heavenly to plop down on after a fun-filled day at Disney.  MARRIOTT IS THE BEST, THEY SAVED MY VACATION AND

Summary: I stayed at this hotel November 2003. I was given a room with blankets and sheets thrown everywhere and went back to get a new room. The shower had hair in it. The Ice bucket had unknown hair in it and took the manager 30 minutes to get me a new one while I waited at the front desk for it.  The manager tried to charge me twice.
